availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles S. Parrott (Hickman County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Hickman County, Kentucky, farmer and planter. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Litsey Parrott in Washington County, Kentucky, on March 12, 1827. Father of James G. Parrott, L. Parrott, Harrison J. Parrott, Uriah Thomas Parrott, P.A. Parrott, Amanda Parrott, George W. Parrott, and Mary A. Parrott. Farmer in Hickman County, Kentucky, in 1840. Owned ten enslaved persons in Hickman County in 1840. Planter in Hickman County in 1850. Owned nineteen enslaved persons in Hickman County in 1850. Planter in Hickman County in 1860. Owned twenty-six enslaved persons in Hickman County in 1860. Household owned an additional two enslaved persons in Hickman County in 1860. Owned Ben [Unknown], Jane [Unknown], Joe [Unknown], and Ritty [Unknown] in Hickman County in 1861.
